title: From Gaza to Odesa, the journey of a Ukrainian family evacuated from one war to another
summary: Over 300 people from Ukraine have been evacuated from the Palestinian territory. Among them, a group of women and their children have taken refuge in the large Ukrainian port city, also subjected to bombings.

title: Mbappé says he will leave PSG at end of season
summary: Football star Kylian Mbappé confirmed on Friday that he would be leaving Paris Saint-Germain at the end of the season but didn't reveal his new club.

title: After Israel took control of the Rafah border crossing, humanitarian operations in Gaza at a standstill
summary: Israeli troops have been deployed in a one-kilometer radius around the border crossing with Egypt, blocking the entry of aid convoys.

title: Strongest solar storm on Earth since 2003: Rare severe geomagnetic storm warning in the US
summary: The planet is experiencing an 'extreme' geomagnetic event and it could produce northern lights in the US this weekend and potentially disrupt power and communications.

title: Japan's efforts to develop whaling, a marginal activity elevated to the rank of national pride
summary: Tokyo is about to add fin whales to the list of whales it allows its fishermen to hunt. The decision confirms the determination to promote the practice despite criticism and the Japanese public's low appetite for whale meat.

title: Protesters gather in support of Israel or Palestine during Eurovision contest in Sweden
summary: While the Israeli candidate, Eden Golan, was taking part in the semi-finals in Malmö, both demonstrations went off without a hitch.

title: In Brazil, fresh rains pound flood-hit south and evacuations double
summary: The deluge – which experts link to climate change exacerbated by the El Nino weather phenomenon – has affected almost 2 million people, leaving 116 dead and 756 injured. Another 143 people are still missing, according to authorities.

title: In the US, police arrest dozens as they break up pro-Palestinian protests in universities
summary: The Associated Press has recorded at least 75 instances since April 18 in which arrests were made at US campus protests. Nearly 2,900 people have been arrested at 57 colleges and universities.

title: Europe's regional inequalities fuel anger and despair
summary: While the economies of EU member states have generally converged in recent years, inequalities have proven difficult to tackle. Some places are falling into a profound slump, fueling votes of discontent.

title: UN votes symbolically in favor of Palestinian membership
summary: The United Nations general assembly approved the Arab and Palestinian-sponsored resolution by a vote of 143-9 with 25 abstentions. The United States voted against the resolution, along with Israel, Argentina, Czechia, Hungary, Micronesia, Nauru, Palau and Papua New Guinea.

title: The headache of returning Emir Abdelkader's sabers to Algeria from France
summary: Key to the reconciliation of memories between the two countries, Algiers' request to recover the national hero's possessions currently held in French museums is likely to come up against a legal dilemma.

title: Russia attacks Ukraine's Kharkiv region in new ground offensive
summary: Russia is looking to create a 'sanitary zone' between Kharkiv in Ukraine and Belgorod in Russia, a region frequently targeted by Ukrainian shelling.

title: Georgia's ambassador to France resigns: 'I call for the withdrawal of the foreign influence bill'
summary: Gocha Javakhishvili is the first Georgian diplomat to resign in protest against his country's pro-Russian turn. He explains his reasons for doing so in an interview with Le Monde.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Arab plan for Gaza's 'day after' hits dead end
summary: The roadmap, which makes recognition of a Palestinian state within the 1967 borders a prerequisite for the resumption of peace negotiations, has been rejected by Washington.

title: Elective egg freezing in France: 'A promise without the means'
summary: Obstetrician and gynecologist François Olivennes deplores abnormally long waiting times despite a law that is supposed to facilitate fertility preservation for women.

title: Top opponent of India PM Modi temporarily released from prison
summary: Arvind Kejriwal, whose camp says the corruption probe against him is a 'political conspiracy,' has been released to campaign in the national election.

title: Labour vows to replace Sunak's Rwanda plan with tougher pre-emptive actions
summary: Labour, which is widely expected to win the next general election later this year after 14 years in opposition, has been under mounting pressure to say what it will do if it is voted into office.

title: Belgium enshrines animal welfare in Constitution
summary: Belgium's Constitution now requires all new decisions to take account of their potential impact on animals. The practical implementation will play out at the regional level.

title: Xi Jinping flatters and seeks to boost Eurosceptic leaders
summary: Welcomed with great pomp in Serbia and Hungary, the Chinese leader praised China's economic partnerships with the two countries, with which he shares a mistrust of the EU.

title: Thomas Piketty: 'If the West truly supports the two-state solution, it must sanction Israel'
summary: In his column, the economist calls on the US and Europe to hit Benjamin Netanyahu and his allies in the wallet.

title: New political crisis in Kuwait, emir dissolves parliament
summary: Parliament, elected in early April, was to meet for the first time on Monday. But several MPs have refused to participate in the government.

title: The quest for the solar system's hidden oceans
summary: While the European JUICE probe is already on its way, NASA is preparing to launch its Europa Clipper probe in October. The two missions are set to characterize the inner oceans of the moons of Jupiter, notably Europa, and Saturn, to establish whether they could constitute favorable environments for sustaining a form of life.

title: How Israel is reshaping the Gaza Strip
summary: While the future governance of the Palestinian enclave is being debated within the Israeli government, the armed forces have systematically destroyed buildings along at least 1 kilometer of the border, creating a militarized corridor that isolates Gaza City.

title: Climate change: Is it time to say goodbye to far-flung family vacations?
summary: They say you should travel far and wide while young. However, global warming stepped in. So should our children only know far-off places through snapshots posted on Instagram? Le Monde journalist Clara Georges tackles the question.

title: What we know about the Chinese espionage operation targeting French lawmakers
summary: In January 2021, several elected representatives received emails sent by APT31, a hacker group suspected of being controlled by Beijing. MEP François-Xavier Bellamy has announced his intention to file a complaint.

title: Turkey's 'Saturday Mothers' vigils call for answers over enforced disappearances
summary: For many years now, groups of relatives of people who disappeared in Turkey have been holding vigils to seek justice.

title: After Mahamat Idriss Déby's disputed victory in Chad, N'Djamena under heavy surveillance
summary: The incumbent president officially won 61% of the vote, but his main opponent Succès Masra is contesting the results.

title: The best places to stay, eat, drink and see in Nice
summary: To visit the city on the French Riviera without getting lost or stumbling into tourist traps, Le Monde journalists selected 20 top addresses.

title: Our selection of the fifteen best croissants in France
summary: Both crispy and melt-in-the-mouth, this buttery classic is sometimes garnished with an extravagant hint of honey, sourdough or praline. From Paris to Nantes to Marseille, here are our favorite spots.

title: Palestinian Authority receives broad support in symbolic UN vote
summary: 143 of the 193 member states considered on Friday that Palestine meets the criteria for full membership of the United Nations. The US voted against the resolution.

title: Rare northern lights seen in Paris region and across the world
summary: NASA had announced that it was expecting such events, after observing explosions on the Sun's surface.

title: Dutch contestant excluded from Eurovision over backstage 'incident'
summary: Joost Klein was dropped by organizers hours before the competition final.
